meanings.definition: characteristic of or resembling a textbook
meanings.sent1: The textbookish cover of the manual caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: Her writing style is very textbookish, making it easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The textbookish font on the sign made it look like a school assignment.
meanings.sent4: His speech was so textbookish, it felt like he was reading from a manual.
meanings.sent5: The textbookish illustrations in the book helped me understand the concepts better.

meanings.definition: overly formal or academic in style or tone
meanings.sent1: She found his textbookish language hard to understand.
meanings.sent2: The professor's lectures can be a bit textbookish at times.
meanings.sent3: His textbookish outfit made him look like a walking dictionary.
meanings.sent4: The lawyer's argument was so textbookish, it put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent5: The textbookish tone of the article made it seem out of touch with reality.
